intro: Mentzelia gracilis, commonly known as slenderleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Mentzelia gracilis is a perennial herb that blooms in late spring to early summer.
